data.title: Best Wells Fargo Credit Cards - Top August 2024 Offers
data.meta_description: Find the best Wells Fargo credit card offers and read reviews at Bankrate.com. Compare credit card rewards, 0% intro APR offers and more to find the right card for you.

A FICO score/credit score is used to represent the creditworthiness of a person and may be one indicator to the credit type you are eligible for. However, credit score alone does not guarantee or imply approval for any financial product.

Apply now Lock

on Wells Fargo's secure site

Intro offer

Earn a $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first 3 months

Info

$200 cash rewards

Rewards rate

Earn unlimited 2% cash rewards on purchases.

Info

2%

Annual fee

$0

Regular APR

20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.99% Variable APR

2% Earn unlimited 2% cash rewards on purchases

Why it’s the best overall: “This card’s flat-rate cash rewards on purchases and user-friendly mobile app both simplified and elevated my experience as a first-time cardholder. As I use this card, I can not only earn rewards, but also get closer to meeting my financial goals.” — Re’Dreyona Walker, Editor, Credit Cards

What we love: Few cash rewards cards earn 2 percent back on purchases, but this one does, making it one of Wells Fargo’s best credit cards. Plus, there's a low spending requirement to earn the welcome bonus, and you’ll have access to many valuable perks and protections, including Visa Signature® benefits.

Learn more: Wells Fargo Active Cash benefits guide

Alternatives: The Discover it® Cash Back could offer more cash back earning opportunities for people who want to maximize their rewards earnings in rotating spending categories.

Pros

The card has no annual fee and a respectable welcome bonus.

You can easily redeem cash rewards for a statement credit.

Cons

It has an intro balance transfer fee that increases from 3 percent to up to 5 percent if you don’t transfer a balance within the first 120 days of account opening (minimum of $5).

The 3 percent foreign currency conversion fee will be disappointing to people who enjoy traveling abroad.

Select “Apply Now” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Earn a $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first 3 months.

Earn unlimited 2% cash rewards on purchases.

0% intro APR for 12 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers. 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.99% Variable APR thereafter; balance transfers made within 120 days qualify for the intro rate and fee of 3% then a BT fee of up to 5%, min: $5.

$0 annual fee.

No categories to track or remember and cash rewards don't expire as long as your account remains open.

Find tickets to top sports and entertainment events, book travel, make dinner reservations and more with your complimentary 24/7 Visa Signature® Concierge.

Up to $600 of cell phone protection against damage or theft. Subject to a $25 deductible.

Best for balance transfers

What we love: If leveraged correctly, this Wells Fargo card can give you one of the longest introductory APRs on the market to help you pay down credit card debt or finance a large purchase. Because the Reflect includes the intro APR for both qualifying balance transfers and purchases, it leads the pack among competing credit cards.

Learn more: Is the Wells Fargo Reflect worth it?

Alternatives: The card doesn’t earn any rewards, so it may not be a fit for people who want a card that holds value for the long haul. The Discover it® Balance Transfer Card and its cash back offer on quarterly rotating categories could prove more rewarding for savvy spenders.

Pros

The card has up to $600 in cell phone protection against damage or theft if you use it to pay your monthly phone bill (subject to a $25 deductible).

You can enroll in Credit Close-Up℠ to get personalized tips on how to improve and maintain your credit score.

Cons

This card charges a 3 percent foreign currency conversion fee, which could prove expensive when using the card abroad.

The lack of a traditional rewards program limits its long-term value.

Select "Apply Now" to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

0% intro APR for 21 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers. 18.24%, 24.74%, or 29.99% variable APR thereafter; balance transfers made within 120 days qualify for the intro rate, BT fee of 5%, min $5.

$0 Annual Fee.

Up to $600 of cell phone protection against damage or theft. Subject to a $25 deductible.

Through My Wells Fargo Deals, you can get access to personalized deals from a variety of merchants. It's an easy way to earn cash back as an account credit when you shop, dine, or enjoy an experience simply by using an eligible Wells Fargo credit card.

Best for rewards category variety

We calculate this number by multiplying the card's intro offer by Bankrate's valuation of this issuer's rewards program, showing you how much your points or miles are worth in dollars.

Info

Info

3X Earn unlimited 3X points on restaurants, travel, gas stations, transit, popular streaming services and phone plans.

1X Earn 1X points on other purchases

What we love: As the most recent addition to Wells Fargo’s consumer credit cards, the Autograph card brings the issuer back into the general travel rewards game. It earns elevated points on restaurant, travel, gas station, transit, popular streaming services and phone plan purchases, giving cardholders more variety in how they can earn.

Learn more: Wells Fargo Autograph benefits guide

Alternatives: The Capital One SavorOne Cash Rewards Credit Card also earns similar rewards rates in some of the Autograph’s categories for no annual fee. However, the SavorOne shines with its grocery category, which the Autograph notably lacks.

Pros

It has a modest intro APR offer period on purchases, giving it a leg up against competing travel cards.

The bonus rewards category variety rivals that of other cards, offering unlimited points on those purchases.

Cons

Points are only worth 1 cent each, notably less than other travel cards’ points and miles.

The Autograph’s welcome offer is much lower than its competitors’ bonuses.

Select "Apply Now" to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Earn 20,000 bonus points when you spend $1,000 in purchases in the first 3 months - that's a $200 cash redemption value.

Earn unlimited 3X points on the things that really add up - like restaurants, travel, gas stations, transit, popular streaming services, and phone plans. Plus, earn 1X points on other purchases.

$0 annual fee.

0% intro APR for 12 months from account opening on purchases. 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.99% variable APR thereafter.

Up to $600 of cell phone protection against damage or theft. Subject to a $25 deductible.

Redeem your rewards points for travel, gift cards, or statement credits. Or shop at millions of online stores and redeem your rewards when you check out with PayPal.

Find tickets to top sports and entertainment events, book travel, make dinner reservations and more with your complimentary 24/7 Visa Signature® Concierge.

Choose your next card with confidence

We’ll find cards matched to your credit profile and see if you qualify for any special offers—all in just two minutes.

Best for travel

1X Earn 1X points on other purchases

What we love: It’s the most flexible and potentially lucrative general travel rewards card Wells Fargo has released so far. It carries a reasonable annual fee, earns bonus rewards across all major travel categories and lets you transfer points to airline and hotel partners, making it a great standalone option for frequent and occasional travelers alike.

Alternatives: Since it earns rewards on both general travel spending and at gas stations, the no-annual-fee Wells Fargo Autograph℠ Card may be a better fit if a lot of your travel spending goes toward “everyday travel” like running errands or commuting to work.

Pros

It’s the only Wells Fargo card that lets you transfer rewards to airline and hotel partners, so it’s your best bet if you don’t mind putting in a bit of work to maximize your redemption value.

It offers a $50 statement credit each year after with a $50 minimum airline purchase — an especially flexible and easy-to-earn annual bonus (many competing cards force you to use credits toward future travel).

Cons

It lacks some popular perks available on other mid-tier rewards cards, like a credit for TSA PreCheck or Clear Plus, so it may not be a perfect fit for all travelers.

Its welcome offer, while generous, carries a heavy spending requirement, which may be tough to reach if you don’t have big expenses on the horizon.

Select “Apply Now” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Earn 60,000 bonus points when you spend $4,000 in purchases in the first 3 months – that’s $600 toward your next trip.

Earn unlimited 5X points on hotels, 4X points on airlines, 3X points on other travel and restaurants, and 1X points on other purchases.

$95 annual fee.

Book your travel with the Autograph Journey Card and enjoy Travel Accident Insurance, Lost Baggage Reimbursement, Trip Cancellation and Interruption Protection and Auto Rental Collision Damage Waiver.

Earn a $50 annual statement credit with $50 minimum airline purchase.

Up to $1,000 of cell phone protection against damage or theft. Subject to a $25 deductible.

Find tickets to top sports and entertainment events, book travel, make dinner reservations and more with your complimentary 24/7 Visa Signature® Concierge.

Best for expedited security screening

Intro offer

Limited Time Offer: Earn 90,000 bonus points when you spend $3,000 in purchases within the first 3 months - enough to redeem for up to 11 Reward nights at select Choice Hotels® properties. Additional fees may apply.

Info

90,000 bonus points

Rewards Rate

Earn 10X points on stays at participating Choice Hotels® properties. Earn 5X points on purchases at gas stations, grocery stores, home improvement stores and phone plan services. Earn 1X points on other purchases.

Info

1X points - 10X points

Annual fee

$95

Regular APR

20.99%, 25.24%, or 29.99% Variable APR

10X points Earn 10X points on stays at participating Choice Hotels® properties.

5X points Earn 5X points on purchases at gas stations, grocery stores, home improvement stores and phone plan services.

1X points Earn 1X points on other purchases.

What we love: This is one of the only hotel rewards cards that offers a credit for TSA PreCheck or Global Entry without charging a huge annual fee. This perk makes it an especially versatile option if you’re a Choice Privileges fan and fly frequently.

Alternatives: The Capital One Venture Rewards Credit Card is a low-cost travel card with a bit more flexibility. Cardholders can redeem rewards for stays at nearly any hotel property and get a credit of up to $100 for their Global Entry or TSA PreCheck application fee.

Pros

Its expedited security screening credit and higher rewards rates should make it more lucrative even than the no-annual-fee Choice Privileges card.

Comes with 30,000 bonus points each year on your account anniversary — easily enough value to offset the card’s annual fee.

Cons

A general travel card can offer more flexibility, allowing you to earn and redeem rewards for stays with any hotel brand, not just Choice Privileges.

Though you can move Choice Privilege points to airline partners, the transfer ratio is very poor (typically 5:1), making transferring rarely worth the trouble.

Select “Apply Now” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Limited Time Offer: Earn 90,000 bonus points when you spend $3,000 in purchases within the first 3 months - enough to redeem for up to 11 Reward nights at select Choice Hotels® properties. Additional fees may apply.

Earn 10X points on stays at participating Choice Hotels® properties.

Earn 5X points on purchases at gas stations, grocery stores, home improvement stores and phone plan services. Plus earn 1X points on other purchases.

$95 annual fee.

Up to $800 of cell phone protection against damage or theft. Subject to a $25 deductible.

Receive 20 Elite night credits qualifying for at least Platinum level status each calendar year.

No Foreign Currency Conversion Fee.
